text:
Family of 4 ~ kids age 7 and 3.
Stayed 3 nights over the Fourth of July 2022.
Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and laidback.
We spent most of the time at the outdoor pool/water park. I was able to keep an eye on my 7 year old as he went down the huge slides and played water basketball. He was able to play freely and had a great time. Kids under 48 inches are not allowed on the big slides. There is an area that has a smaller slide that kids of all ages can use and it was a big hit.
We didn’t explore the indoor water park much because the weather was so nice. However periodically there would be a 30 min break for the lifeguards and the swimmers outside. By the last day we learned the breaks were not at the same time.
Also,  adult beverages were available and prices were reasonable.  Despite a bar on site it was still family friendly.
The rule of No outside food or drinks was not enforced. Lots of families brought their own snacks and drinks down to the pool. Which I think worked out because the food concessions was overwhelmed and understaffed. The resort appeared to be understaffed in general - likely true for many places in the area right now. But like I said everyone was friendly, and pretty chill.
Lifeguards did not enforce much either and at times arguably may have been a sleep. Life jackets are allowed, and I would highly encourage them for kids who cannot swim well. My 3 year old wore a puddle jumper and it was perfect. Nearby restaurants were amazing and had a great time at Arnold’s park. We will go again!

text:
We arrived late at night, so we didn't inspect the room very well before crawling in bed and falling asleep. When we woke up, I could see oily fingerprints on the headboard, something sneezed or splashed onto the TV, someone's grocery store card they accidentally left behind, and some rather dirty looking blood stains on one of the pillow cases.

The tiles and grout near the tub were a bit in disrepair, but overall things appeared tolerably clean and satisfactory unless you looked closely. I feel like the cleaning job is one of the biggest customer services a hotel can offer, because you don't want to feel like you're constantly touching other people's left behind germs, lube residue, etc. It was a major detraction.

The breakfast was okay but the lady behind the counter (responsible for cooking the eggs and everything) seemed spread very thin in her duties.

I would have preferred paying a little more at this hotel for it to be a place with a better cleaning service. If it wasn't for the room  cleanliness the experience would have been more like 3½ stars for me.

text: I would count this as a great quality medium-priced Hotel.  They had a great entryway and the elevator has a security code so the guests are safe.  They have a great atrium with a pool and a hot tub which is open until late including an adult swim from 11 p.m. to 2 a.m. They have a full breakfast bar in the morning until 10:30 which is nice.  The rooms are modern and well-stocked with coffee maker and frigerator.  All of this was only $96 for the night.  There's also a restaurant in the hotel and a full bar.  so once you park you can really stay put for the night and not have to leave.  Definitely hang the do not disturb sign on your door or they will knock on your door in the morning before check out to clean the rooms.

text:
We were able to book this fun hotel during an “off week”. We spent 2/5 days without leaving. They truly offer everything.

Not long after we checked in, they sent us 2 free app coupons & a bottle of champagne with a thoughtful note for our anniversary.

Our king room was clean & spacious. The bed was SO fluffy, which I loved. We had a partial ocean view which was nice bc that wasn’t what I booked. Most reviews say rooms are outdated, I guess they kind of are but it’s not terrible. Every day we walked past rooms being cleaned, like furniture flipped over & scrubbing. (I’m sure it’s easier for them to do in down time.) I was seriously impressed. The room had complementary water & coffee, a fridge, iron, hair dryer..etc Our only inconvenience was no microwave for leftovers.

All of the staff was so welcoming and kind! Someone said they were short handed, like everywhere, but we didn’t really notice until our last day when a lot more people started coming in. Even then, it wasn’t a problem for us.

The Spa! I wish we would’ve thought to book services sooner. It’s pricey but worth it!

The pools are nice & grounds well manicured. Pools close at 9 which was disappointing. We wanted to use the hot tub at night but couldn’t seem to get there before then.

The walk to the beach is easy with a nice path. We took advantage of the lifeguards umbrella & chair rentals. I believe it was $40 a day. The beach was a little crowded the 2 days we were able to go. I just thought, I couldn’t imagine how busy it would be in the summer.

Last, find the breakfast buffet! They have everything. It was wild. Lol

Overall, we would stay here again if it was in our budget & low crowds. This place is expensive along with every extra thing to go with it. It was our anniversary so we splurged. We enjoyed every day!!!
prompt: A Google Maps review about a Hotel.
completion:
We were able to book this fun hotel during an “off week”. We spent 2/5 days without leaving. They truly offer everything.

Not long after we checked in, they sent us 2 free app coupons & a bottle of champagne with a thoughtful note for our anniversary.

Our king room was clean & spacious. The bed was SO fluffy, which I loved. We had a partial ocean view which was nice bc that wasn’t what I booked. Most reviews say rooms are outdated, I guess they kind of are but it’s not terrible. Every day we walked past rooms being cleaned, like furniture flipped over & scrubbing. (I’m sure it’s easier for them to do in down time.) I was seriously impressed. The room had complementary water & coffee, a fridge, iron, hair dryer..etc Our only inconvenience was no microwave for leftovers.

All of the staff was so welcoming and kind! Someone said they were short handed, like everywhere, but we didn’t really notice until our last day when a lot more people started coming in. Even then, it wasn’t a problem for us.

The Spa! I wish we would’ve thought to book services sooner. It’s pricey but worth it!

The pools are nice & grounds well manicured. Pools close at 9 which was disappointing. We wanted to use the hot tub at night but couldn’t seem to get there before then.

The walk to the beach is easy with a nice path. We took advantage of the lifeguards umbrella & chair rentals. I believe it was $40 a day. The beach was a little crowded the 2 days we were able to go. I just thought, I couldn’t imagine how busy it would be in the summer.

Last, find the breakfast buffet! They have everything. It was wild. Lol

Overall, we would stay here again if it was in our budget & low crowds. This place is expensive along with every extra thing to go with it. It was our anniversary so we splurged. We enjoyed every day!!!

text: I would give my stay a C. For a resort, lots of things that were subpar. Check in took me 20 minutes (on a Sunday in February). I was given an "upgrade" - to a room directly outside the gym. Every time someone came in/out, the door slammed. That went on until 10:30p and started at 6:40a. The sheets barely covered the bed. Rhe pillows were not traditional Marriott pillows. And the bath mat was at the point that I would have donated it to the local animal shelter. Also, parking was difficult- i had no idea that there was underground parking. The pros were the cleanliness of the room, the TV in the room, and the location (right on the beach). Would I go back? Possibly; it's not off my list completely.

text:
This is our first time staying at this location. I hope to give some thorough information as I read many mixed reviews before staying here ....
The hotel itself is slightly outdated. This can be seen on many reviews. Now, even though it is outdated, it is still VERY well kept overall. The rooms were very clean, the food areas were great and the common areas inside the hotel were beautiful. The pool areas did need attention. There were frequently plastic cups floating in one of the pools. A waterfall feature of the pool was not in use anymore and instead had many trash pieces and was starting to grow fungus looking things.
The restaurants were very yummy and service there was great. Drinks were tasty and priced well.
The biggest frustration of the hotel was the communication and activity calendar. They hand you an activity calendar and I spent much time preparing my kids for the great activities. However, most workers didn't know what was going on, some events didn't even occur. Kids crafts were free one day and then the next they were $17 to paint a canvas and make a pinwheel. The movie stated on the calendar was not the movie playing one night. It was just sad to see so many great events planned but yet, no communication and no great follow through.
Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel many times again. I do hope that somehow they can get better communication between the workers and the events calendar. They set themselves apart having fun activities, now they just need to follow through!

text:
We came to Hilton Head Island for Memorial Day because we never get away for the holidays. It was such a pleasurable experience. The resort was not very busy for being a holiday weekend. There was lots of activities and there is immediate beach access.

The rooms were a little humid even with the air conditioning at 65 which made for some sticky night sleeps but still very cold for the hot weather we experienced.

The food at View 32 was excellent. We highly recommend the Grilled Cheese BLT Panini! I wish they still had the lobster roll from a few years ago when we visited but I was able to find that at a nearby local restaurant. The servers we had were also amazing!

I also had delightful experiences with Clive from the Front Desk and Madison from Guest Services. They had exceptional customer service skills which is the reason I choose Marriott!

We will definitely be visiting again! Thank you to the Westin staff for your hospitality!
prompt: A Google Maps review about a Hotel.
completion:
We came to Hilton Head Island for Memorial Day because we never get away for the holidays. It was such a pleasurable experience. The resort was not very busy for being a holiday weekend. There was lots of activities and there is immediate beach access.

The rooms were a little humid even with the air conditioning at 65 which made for some sticky night sleeps but still very cold for the hot weather we experienced.

The food at View 32 was excellent. We highly recommend the Grilled Cheese BLT Panini! I wish they still had the lobster roll from a few years ago when we visited but I was able to find that at a nearby local restaurant. The servers we had were also amazing!

I also had delightful experiences with Clive from the Front Desk and Madison from Guest Services. They had exceptional customer service skills which is the reason I choose Marriott!

We will definitely be visiting again! Thank you to the Westin staff for your hospitality!

text:
You pick the Westin for location location location. They are right on the beach and many of their rooms face the ocean with small porches. Some (like ours) are on the ocean, which was a great choice.

Beach access is really convenient. So convenient in fact we didn't use the pool once. The beach might be one of the best I've seen, easily beating Maui, HI. Make sure to take advantage of the chair / umbrella rental service with beach patrol. They don't ask for tips or have a tip jar, but I encourage you to tip generously. They are fantastic and work extremely hard.

The service at the hotel was extremely responsive and friendly, although the front desk was often overwhelmed with lack of concierge support, so I'd STRONGLY encourage you to submit any service requests through the Bonvoy (Marriott loyalty) app. They even found an item I left in the room last checkout, and held it for me. That rarely happens and is a sign of great training.

We used the on-property restaurant for apps and drinks, but it wasn't our thing. If you're a Applebee's or Chili's fan you will probably enjoy it, albeit they do charge resort prices. If you're a fan of Chefs that use seasonal ingredients, win notable awards, and obsess about details, you may not enjoy it.

The property was very clean, the service was extremely friendly, but the rooms themselves are really showing their age as are the furnishings. Worn furniture with slight staining and spotting is expected when staying here. To be clear, we did our best not to track sand in our room, but when we did, it would magically disappear when housekeeping tidying up the room. They were very thorough, even cleaning our windows when they got too much ocean salt on them. Well done!

The pool was always chaotic and guests reserve chairs early in the morning and don't come back until much later. There supposedly is a rule that doesn't allow this but it wasn't enforced. First come first serve. Like I said, we didn't care because the beach was breathtaking.

text:
The hotel is not cleaning rooms. They claim that it's to address covid that they aren't doing any room cleaning during stays. But our room was still dirty even when we first checked in! So, they just aren't cleaning enough in between, either. The tub was downright grimy, there was sand everywhere, and the place doesn't smell fresh. Had very mixed service experience, some front desk staff are trying hard but some on the phone line are actually rude.

The location is great with two paths to a wonderful beach, both paths have freshwater spray to get sand off. There are also multiple pools with options that please all the family -- including a shaded pool if you want to enjoy a swim even after a sunburn. So if the service were better this would be a great stay.

text: Family Friendly.  This was not my usual overnight.  I live local and decided that I didn't want to clean my house between nights.  So I stayed on the island.  I'm so glad I did.  The weather was perfect.  Thank you God.  The rooms were nice and clean.  Not sure if the bedding was a weighted blanket or not but kinda felt like it.  Onsite amenities galore from dining, many pools, beach access and rental options for beach and trail.  If you golf, well it's Hilton Head Island.  Enough said.  Lots of pool side activities for the kids like ping pong and Cornhole.  Even the coi seemed to entertain them for a while.  We had a lovely overall experience here.

text:
Overall the hotel was nice. The front desk staff was very helpful and accommodated all of our needs. The views were amazing. The rooms were spacious and clean. Where our visit fell VERY short was our dining experience. The first restaurant we went to told us there was a 55 minute wait, even though more than half of the restaurant was empty. They told us to try the outside area so we wnt out there only to be told "we have nothing to offer you" even though they had empty seats as well. We went back inside and the bartender told us we could sit at a hightop table in the bar. It did take us about
30 minutes to get any service at all but we definitely didn't need to wait 55 minutes. The server was nice and the apps were very good especially the Mason jar appetizer. The mains were okay. My crab and shrimp fettuccine was SMOTHERED in sauce almost making it inedible. My husband's burger was overdone but it was still good. The one thing that was a hit was my son's NY strip and fries..that was delicious and cooked and seasoned perfectly.....the drinks were very good too! Overall I would have gone somewhere else for food if we hadn't got in so late. There are so many great places in the area to try....however the hotel was a nice place to stay.

text:
This was our second stay at the property, so we had expectations that it would match our previous one. That was not the case at all.

Our room was somewhat clean on arrival even though there were sunflower seed shells scattered at the entrance that remained during our stay even with multiple housekeeping visits. On our first morning, we noticed that we had not been given washcloths. Instead, there was a wet one hanging from the shower rod. Disgusting. I contacted the front desk three times and it took an hour to receive them. That’s a bit extreme. Not to mention they seemed to be surprised/bothered by the request. I know I was by the third call. There was also trash underneath the bed that we were in no way going to retrieve and neither did the housekeeping staff feel it necessary.

What happened next will go in my book of the most disgusting hotel experiences ever. While completing some emails, I noticed there was a weird yellow stain on the partially exposed mattress pad. I didn’t want to think it was what I immediately thought it was, but then I took a whiff. It was unmistakably urine. I immediately called the front desk and asked for the manager after telling them what I found. I received a call about ten minutes later saying that the manager was unavailable and that a supervisor from housekeeping would be up to check out the situation. After the call, I did a little more inspecting and actually lifted the mattress pad. That when I discovered a large urine stain directly on the mattress. Took pictures as well. I called back and informed the front desk, and while they were surprised, communicated no sense of urgency as I demanded to see the manager again to have the mattress replaced. I became tired of waiting and went to the beach for the last few hours that our rented space was available. It was my expectation that the mattress would be replaced by the time I returned. Nope! So, I called again demanding the manager and a fresh mattress. Instead, I was offered to switch rooms, to which I replied, “You want us to pack up the entire room to go to another room with a potential whole different set of problems?” Needless to say, that didn’t sit well. So, I waited some more until about 30 minutes later someone from housekeeping finally showed up to assess the situation. Again, she offered to move us and again I declined and expressly told them to change the mattress and replace the linens. After some huffing and puffing of disbelief by the housekeeping representative, a new mattress finally arrived. Then she proceeded to put the same linens that were on the soiled mattress back on the new mattress to which we had to emphatically correct that behavior, to which also was accompanied by disbelief on her part. The rest of our time in the room we just felt dirty and never really clean. Not to mention a daily vacuuming of a hotel room beachfront would have been a nice touch. Plus, I couldn’t believe that an oceanfront room was smaller than the suite we had on the previous stay, but I digress.

There were a few occasions that we ate in the Carolina Room and while the service was excellent, the space wasn’t maintained well at all. During a breakfast visit, we were seated at a table where it appeared that the remnants of the previous diner’s meal was scattered all over the floor. I’m not sure why the hostess thought that was appropriate and we were hoping that someone would notice and it at least clean up the debris. That didn’t happen. The breakfast buffet was underwhelming and we about got severely burned by the chafing dish containing the grits. The food was edible, but needless to say, we didn’t return for breakfast going forward. Dinner on the other hand was pretty good and we had particularly attentive service.

In the end, we won’t be back and will advise our friends of the same. Perhaps assuming that our expectations would be met based on our previous stay was a mistake. We definitely didn’t get what we paid for.

So, I waited some more until about 30 minutes later someone from housekeeping finally showed up to assess the situation. Again, she offered to move us and again I declined and expressly told them to change the mattress and replace the linens. After some huffing and puffing of disbelief by the housekeeping representative, a new mattress finally arrived. Then she proceeded to put the same linens that were on the soiled mattress back on the new mattress to which we had to emphatically correct that behavior, to which also was accompanied by disbelief on her part. The rest of our time in the room we just felt dirty and never really clean. Not to mention a daily vacuuming of a hotel room beachfront would have been a nice touch. Plus, I couldn’t believe that an oceanfront room was smaller than the suite we had on the previous stay, but I digress.

There were a few occasions that we ate in the Carolina Room and while the service was excellent, the space wasn’t maintained well at all. During a breakfast visit, we were seated at a table where it appeared that the remnants of the previous diner’s meal was scattered all over the floor. I’m not sure why the hostess thought that was appropriate and we were hoping that someone would notice and it at least clean up the debris. That didn’t happen. The breakfast buffet was underwhelming and we about got severely burned by the chafing dish containing the grits. The food was edible, but needless to say, we didn’t return for breakfast going forward. Dinner on the other hand was pretty good and we had particularly attentive service.

In the end, we won’t be back and will advise our friends of the same. Perhaps assuming that our expectations would be met based on our previous stay was a mistake. We definitely didn’t get what we paid for.

The rest of the trip was 5 stars. The casino and staff were great as always. Casino staff were very helpful and polite again. We will go back. Just someone needs to address the check in process. Maybe install a check in kiosk like the larger Cherokee property has.

text: This was my 1st experience, I believe first impressions are lasting impressions..Upon arrival I noticed 3 lines Diamond members, Seven star members and regular guests..I was a regular guest who had a reservation...but if they were ever trying to get me to be a diamond member I would have liked a nice check-in experience and it wasn't pleasant at ALL...they kept looking for Diamond and Star guests first I get it, I am a delta skymiles member and I get priority everything but I have never witnessed delta just ignore other customers who weren't skymiles members they are also accommodated along with priority customers..this was NOT the case at this Casino. The ladies at the front desk kept calling for these priority members while ignoring all the other guests and my daughter said "We've be standing here for quite some time do you just plan on calling for diamond and seven star members only because people are literally just walking in and you're ignoring us and are we ever getting checked in?" Well ANN was nasty in her response and once she was cleared of customers she did not bother helping us but the young lady next to her called us up while her customer had not yet cleared the counter. ANN is not a good look for this establishment when u are dealing with customers and your rooms are 458.00 a night on the weekend, things need to be DIFFERENT make guests feel welcome...ALL GUESTS...I guess I will see if the BIGGER resort wants my money and appreciate me next time. I will NOT return here...clean nice AVERAGE rooms...casino floor staff were pleasant..

text: We stopped at Harrah's Cherokee Valley River on the way back from Harrah's Cherokee Resort.  We didn't know anything about it until we passed it on the way up. It's smaller, but still a very nice casino. Craps tables were a $15 minimum, which is good. I won a little on the quarter slot machines. And I'd say the food court here is better than the one at the resort. We will be going back and staying here the next time. There's really no use in driving an hour more (from the Atlanta metro area) to the resort when this casino offers the same thing.

text: Food is great and has great eats from places that I'm mostly familiar with. 95% staff is friendly, very enthusiastic, and takes pride in their jobs. I will say the security had issues reading my newer Georgia state ID upon entry. It could've been just me since I was upset I had problems accessing the casino area a few times, but it just didn't make sense that my Georgia ID didn't work, but my former NY state ID did. One security guard outside was very hostile to me where she intervened my sidetalk with my partner and told me that I can try to enter through the other side, but they wont allow me back in by any circumstances. I gave it a try and behold, my NY state ID works! If this casino can fix the issue with newer Georgia IDs, it would no longer be a hassle, but thank goodness I had ID from a different state. The casino otherwise had numerous slots to play from, and the atmosphere was very welcoming to all. I will have numerous visits, and if you're reading this as a Georgia resident, if your ID was issued 2020 or later, you might be told to leave.

Overall it’s a nice casino with good eating options and great staff.

I was in the 8th floor with a fantastic view to the ocean. They offer breakfast…the only thing I was missing is vanilla creamer for my coffee..This is an excellent Hotel. I was really impressed! Also, they are 5 miles from Gulf State Park 💕; you have to visit! For people that have dogs there is a dog pond park “brand new” and other amazing amenities. To the manager of this facility I had wrote this review a month ago, but I have put the wrong address (Gulf Shores)…this review is for you guys! I thank the entire staff Liz and the other team’s members…all of you are doing a wonderful and amazing JOB! Thank you so much for always receiving with welcome hands and big smile!

text: We had a great stay! The room was clean, cozy and the view was great. Right on the main stretch of orange beach, breakfast was great. My only complaint would be the tiki bar closes too early and it would be nice if the pool had adult hours after 10. But nothing to bat an eye at. We will definitely be returning.

My only complaint would be the tiki bar closes too early and it would be nice if the pool had adult hours after 10. But nothing to bat an eye at. We will definitely be returning.

text: Our first room the carpet was wet. Changed to another room. The beds were so worn couldn’t hardly stay in bed they were broken down at the edges. Sink didn’t drain, drawers were broken, shower handle wouldn’t stay in place for the temperature control. Changed to another room.  The toilet tank has a large crack. Air conditioner leaked so bad we laid towels down to soak up the water and it was so bad the towels could be wrung out.  Very moldy.  Found a dead cockroach the 3 night.  The morning we checked out a 4 inch cockroach came out from under the sofa. The floor was saturated for about 8 feet.  3 of us have acute sinus infections and sore throats from living in this roach and mold infested room.  The problem is they don’t have other rooms to move you to because of being fully booked. They say they will send maintenance to check the problem but they don’t show up. The place needs a major remodel. The breakfast was meh. They had a hard time keeping up with filling the empty items and rarely wiped off the tables.  I have been a Hilton Honors member for many years and have stayed many times in the Hilton family hotels. This was the worse hotel I have ever stayed in.  I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.     I also don’t understand why when I checked my review I attached photos of the wet towels and the large cockroach  they are not showing the photos on my post.  This hotel needs to be completely transparent in letting customers show the conditions of your hotel.

text:
The pros were the location, the view and the walk to the beach. We paid for an oceanfront view, and the view was gorgeous. Breakfast was also great. Most of the staff we interacted with were lovely.

I don’t usually nitpick, but I was paying $400 a night and find some things just not excusable at that price.
They don’t have daily maid service, and you have to go down to get towels/toilet paper and take out your own trash. Again, for the price I was paying, I think daily service would be expected. You can only get a full service every 5 days.
They are dog friendly, which is amazing…but there was no place to take them to the bathroom. The abandoned lot next door was what we opted for, but it was filled with thorny and burred plants. They are not allowed on the beach (city law) so there are really no options. At one point we tried to use a tiny patch of grass outside the fence, but the bartender from the pool told us it was gross to have them within eyesight and we needed to take our dogs off property to use the bathroom.

text:
For nearly $500/night, I was expecting more than the standard hotel however, it was nothing more than average.  The front desk was nice but I had to walk by an overly full garbage can when walking in, so that set the tone. I wouldn’t mind really, but it was that way every day that I was there. The can in the pool area was also overflowing by lunch and never changed until the end of the day.
This place has a smaller than average pool with very little seating. Approx 20 lounge chairs and there was room for many more. There were no umbrellas or tables In the pool area and very little shade.  There is a small bar outside that had some shaded seating. Prices for cocktails was $12+ .  Bring your ant spray, as there was an abundance of ants around the pool.  The breakfast seating area is a decent size but it doesn’t accommodate the amount of people that can stay at that hotel. I know it’s not reasonable to plan for every patron to eat breakfast at the same time however, when it’s 15-20 min wait to make a waffle or wait on some other item to come out so you can have something before they close the doors on you, then it’s a problem.
Our room had a rusted, I mean RUSTED, like throw it away it’s so rusty, lamp.

Room was very clean, gulf view, great AC, and it was quiet. Across the street are a few restaurants, walking distance to Starbucks. Publix and Walmart very close by.

Construction is starting next door on new giant condos so the peace and quiet May be gone soon…. That’s also the same side as the bar.

text:
Stayed 3 nights at the Hampton.🌙
In the room we had a microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot and hairdryer.  The white sheets/white comforters and room were clean & comphy. I especially appreciate having had full use of the heated indoor pool, hot tub and gym that close at 10pm.  Also, the ice machines work🧊 and the breakfast included fresh fruit, juices, coffee, muffins... Being able to walk out of the back door to the beautifully kept beach with no animals, jet ski's, etc. was wonderful.  Would definitely stay there again!

text:
First of all, the few employees they had working were friendly and helpful but there were not many.   I had to go down to the desk to pick up fresh towels daily and I emptied our trash myself.   It was entirely self catering with no maid service at all.  We were there four days and nobody swept our room or even the hallway.

The room seemed clean but there were small things like the old coffee pods were left in the pots from the former visitors and one bedspread had a nasty looking stain. I took the spread down and asked for a replacement but they did not have any.

On the positive side, the breakfasts were very plentiful and tasty.  We would have liked it if the hotel had kept the coffee available all day like other Hampton Inns do but they did give us coffee packets so we could make it in our room.

We stayed in one of the suites and it was a nice room.  It's getting a little dated but not too bad.   The view from the 9th floor was wonderful.  We enjoyed sitting on the balcony, though one of the chairs was missing a leg.  Requests for an additional chair were ignored.  Luckily we had brought some beach chairs.

text: This is the PERFECT place for families with kids who want to getaway to the beach! In the morning breakfast is made for you (eggs/omelettes, fruit, cereal, waffles, yogurt) then just head out to the beach. It's literally just a few steps out there, then spend the day between there and the pool and hot tub. They have a bar open just a few days a week, the gym is huge and BEAUTIFUL ocean view while you work out! The gym has quite a few treadmills, ellipticals, weights and thoughtful extras like a private bathroom and cold filtered water dispenser. We get a balcony room with a studio (basically a divided room with a couch and chair on one side, beds on the other) and they do have adjoining rooms for larger families. The gulf view is amazing. The whole place is just so relaxed and chill! Our rooms have included mini fridge and microwave which comes in handy. The rooms are very clean and seem well-maintained. All front desk and breakfast staff have been so nice and helpful. They do have laundry, 2nd floor (across from the gym) and it's $1.50 in quarters per wash or dry cycle. Definitely recommend, we will be back!

text:
💙💜⛱️What a wonderful stay here! Employees are firendly at the front desk and the cleaning team.

Rooms are pretty plain and simple, but that doesnt matter. I cant imagine many people will spend much time in their room, except to sleep.🛌 The hotel🏢 is directly on the beach! 🏖👐🙌👏

A lounge chair rental service w is available for rent at $35 a day. You can walk directly from the hotel to the beach via a wooden  boardwalk w a few stairs. The white sand is so soft and the sound of the waves just took our stress away. ⛱️

Outside pool and hottub also face the beach.

Parking permit for the garage at check in. Easily elevator access frlm the garage too.

Most rooms with balconies facing the ocean are double beds🛌 instead of kings, which could be good for families.

🧽Very clean, did I mention clean!!!🧼 Absolutely will return to this Hampton when we are in town again. Very satisfied multi year diamond member here.

There is an outside tiki bar for drinks and the full beach affect too! 🍸🍷🍹

During the stay a 🌀storm blew in and it was very cold, so we hit the hot tub. I saw alot of kiddos playing in the pool and a few adults. It is a heated pool, but not as warm as the hot tub🏟, so the hot tub it was for me.

text:
We stayed here for several nights. It was our first visit to the Gulf Shores/Orange Beach area. This inn was a nice little place to stay.
The hotel itself is in decent condition with updated modern designs and comfort. The doors going into the room and balcony could have used a little maintenence. The room had a spectacular view of the Gulf and we enjoy the balcony alot. The pool/hottub was clean enough and a had great temps every time. Their beach area was always kept nice and we spent alot of time just enjoying the waves.
The breakfast was always served hot and there was always plenty even though we often ate towards the end of the meal time. They serve you instead of you picking what you want - Covid19 restrictions.
The only reason they are losing a star - we had to ask for everything. Since they are not cleaning the rooms and restocking supplies and clean towels each day, we were left to ask for toilet paper, new paper cups, coffee, etc. Several times it seemed as though they didn't want to get anything for us and that we were imposing on them to ask for a trash bags or whatever. I would suggest having a time frame each morning that the guests could get what they need without "disturbing" the front desk staff. Other than that the staff was pleasant.
One of the elevators was out of service the entire time we were there. Apparently it has been out for several weeks.. while most of time it wasn't too long of a wait, during the weekends it got a little crazy.
The Tiki bartender (Oscar) is funny! Enjoy as few beers with him.

text: A section of the beach is dedicated to hotel guests, and there are large beach umbrellas and sturdy beach chairs with wooden frames available for rental. Though nothing else compares to the emerald green waters and the sugar sand, there is also an indoor and an outdoor swimming pool. Our stay was short, just a couple of nights and one full day, but we enjoyed it very much. We particularly enjoyed our meal at the open-air restaurant by the outdoor pool. We also enjoyed our first floor room with quick access to the beach, and the room was very clean and well-maintained. The gift shop was open until ten and had candy and soft drinks to satisfy my late night craving for chocolate. The staff was great. October was a great time for a visit to The Emerald Coast.

text: I loved this resort up until today. I have visited several times since last year, and have never had 1 problem. My previous visits, the rooms were dated, with a musty, moldy odor. We were on the 7th floor where the toilets were way too small.  They were very low to the floor. But, Crystal Haire, the AWESOME Front Office Supervisor, was very nice and professional. She upgraded both my rooms to the newly renovated rooms, with a perfect beachview! Both my rooms are junior deluxe suits, with two queen beds with pull out lamps on both sides of the bed, one sofa bed, and two junior beds. Each junior bed has their very own tv. The bathroom has the barnyard sliding door, and the rooms are cooling much better than before, as the vent was in the corner, blocked by the curtain, and in an area where is was impossible to cool the room properly. Now there are 2 vents located in a proper area to cool the room properly. Estelle is also very nice, friendly, and personable. She works the food and beverage area. She has a great personality. It goes a long way with me. This is a great resort, in a very nice location. I have 6 of my family members here for the very 1st time. They wanted to the beautiful water. The tides were up, so We couldn't get into the water. The water was barely touching our feet, as so many others. Hilton's beach police/security drove up to us us specifically, and told us that we couldn't allow the water to touch our feet. We were all stunned, because there were so many others doing the exact same thing. Even further into the water. He drove off, and some non-blacks asked what did he say to us, and we told her. This one in particular was saddened! She said look at all these other doing the same, and some are practically swimming, and nothing has been said to them. I actually wanted to leave, and go home. We hadn't been there for 5 minutes when he came up to us. This occurred around 10 a.m., so you'll know who was on duty.  But, I'm yet here with my family. Please see pictures of others walking through the water. Prejudice is very much alive. Other than this, you all would get 5 plus stars. Hayden Edelman and Kimberly Arnold at PICNIX, the ice cream parlour were very nice, friendly, and professional.

text: The Hilton Sandestin Beach Golf Resort and Spa has my vote. I booked this place because I wanted to be on the beach surrounded by gorgeous views. This is my 4th trip to Destin, and I wanted a no worries vacation. I was able to walk right on the beach from the hotel. One can rent chairs and umbrellas from 9-5 or bring their own. The beach is super clean with powdery sand perfect for strolling, building sand castles, playing volleyball, etc. Additionally, jet ski and banana boats are available within a short few paces. I’ve been satisfied with the hotel/room amenities, restaurants, indoor/outdoor pools and hot tubs. I’m ready to rebook this hotel for another vacation in the near future. The property is enjoyable for families, couples, and solo travelers!

text: The beach was lovely, they have an indoor pool and outdoor pool and spa.  The people who work here pleasant. The downside for the Hilton name these rooms did not live up. One air conditioning vent for the whole room, in Florida, in the middle of the night my husband and I had to kick off the covers we were sweating and we had the room set to 60. Couldn’t find the TV remote control anywhere in the room but we didn’t come to watch TV that’s just a point. When it comes to our view everyone else has an open balcony view of the ocean we have wood and the roof of the building behind us.   The dj and pool patrons where right under our room and exquisitely loud.   This is where the tv remote would have come in handy.   If we stay here again it will not be in room 228

text: I had a fantastic vacation here! This resort is beautiful. We had originally booked our stay for 3 nights but we loved it so much we decided to cancel our trip to gulf shores and just extend our stay here the whole week. I loved the beach set up you could get with the umbrella and chairs and the beach was so beautiful and clean. The spa is wonderful and the dining options and cocktails in the resort were great. The golf course seems nice but I never went golfing. We got an ocean view room and had a beautiful view of the ocean, we even got to spot some dolphins swimming close to shore some of the mornings! It is on the expensive side but we felt it was worth it to indulge while on vacation. I would come back here and highly recommend it to others.

text:
Amazing staff.  Felt very welcomed.  Valet / Bellman in both areas superb at their job, thank you for taking care of our vehicle and luggage. Guest services / night audit April was very informative and helpful upon arrival and when we needed assistance with our  settings for the A/C. Don Ricos restaurant superb food and beverage staff. Thank you to the whole team.
I enjoyed all the guest areas .  I enjoyed the ocean view room for the view and very spacious.  Dated lamps are worn  and little things around the room. The only thing I didn’t like was the musty smell of water, wet carpet.  The bathroom could of been cleaned better. Behind the toilet where there’s caulking is mildew.  My room was on the fourth floor ocean view so we had the ultimate view.  I really enjoyed it here. I hope the hotel will be updated soon. I work in hospitality and I understand that this industry was very much affected by the pandemic and not mention storms that haven’t helped and it’s slowly getting more people hired and getting the experience staff hired and trying make revenue as well.   Keeping guests feeling comfortable and welcomed is always number one.  I will be a repeat guest.

text: My family and I enjoyed the brief time we spent here. The amenities were a plus, the views were amazing, and the location was convenient. If you book through a third-party beware. text: This hotel is mismanaged and full of hidden fees. Two of the elevators in the south tower have been out of operation for at least a month. It can take up to 20 minutes to get an elevator and there is a line for the elevator at peak times. McDonald's are managed better. The entrance is so small that we had to sit in line out in the road waiting for the hotel. This is a hazard for guests and a liability for the hotel. I do not understand why this is a Hilton when it I haven't experienced this mismanagement at extended stay. The pool was nice but not very deep. The hot tub was small. The parking was extremely expensive. The food in the hotel is also expensive. There are no proper heaters in the rooms so if it is cold, you will suffer. We called the engineer and he said they have toaster ovens for heaters in the rooms. His quote. Too many hidden fees and too high of a cost for having half elevators working and being forced to wait out in the street to get to the hotel.

text:

Really enjoyed this hotel.  The beds were just right for our extended stay.  Close to lots of food options.  We ate and drank at Don Rico’s in the lobby quite a few times and enjoyed that.

The rooms are nothing spectacular but are decently clean with no signs of bed bugs.  Showers work ok, sinks don’t back up on you and the view was awesome.

We slept with our sliding door open every night so we could feel the cool ocean breeze and hear the waves all night.

text:
This place was way below our expectations we decided to spend a little more and stay at a known hotel line rather than risking it with an unknown place just to enjoy our weekend away. And we were WRONG, the picture attached of the rusted bathroom equipment was just 1 of many unacceptable issues.

Service: the worse, upon arrival they were very flat not very welcoming this place is huge with different things going on and no one even told me anything I had to figure out where and what everything was. But that’s not even the issue. House keeping is almost impossible to get I’ve never been to a hotel where you have to call a specific number to request it within a restricted time frame. Zero small bathroom/shower supplies. We were charged 40 dollars a night for valet parking and no one even answered the phone when we had a dinner date to get our car so we had to walk to the actual place then wait for the car.

The restaurants and bars mind you that are already over priced have awful service because they are SOOOO understaffed this one poor man was literally running the entire Resturant and bar while getting yelled at. The one pool bar they had, there were like 10-12 people wrapped around in a line just to get one drink by the pool in the hot heat so we said forget it the second time 😩 The first night on arrival when I tried to take a quick rinse/shower  the water stopped draining.

But other than that the room wasn’t dirty the sheets were clean that’s all I gave you guys sadly. And I’m not one to leave reviewed but I HAD to give the next people a heads up.

Also i mentioned it to the manager and she didn’t even offer anything she said “I’ll talk to house keeping “. Most other places would at the very least try to make up for the bad service to protect their standards .. not at all.

If I could do it again I would reserve at the other ocean front hotels. My partner and I checked out the other ones and they actually looked really nice and inviting like they wanted to earn guests. I guess these big name hotels feel like because they have the name they don’t have to try as hard now? Not sure.
prompt: A Google Maps review about a Hotel.
completion:
This place was way below our expectations we decided to spend a little more and stay at a known hotel line rather than risking it with an unknown place just to enjoy our weekend away. And we were WRONG, the picture attached of the rusted bathroom equipment was just 1 of many unacceptable issues.

Service: the worse, upon arrival they were very flat not very welcoming this place is huge with different things going on and no one even told me anything I had to figure out where and what everything was. But that’s not even the issue. House keeping is almost impossible to get I’ve never been to a hotel where you have to call a specific number to request it within a restricted time frame. Zero small bathroom/shower supplies. We were charged 40 dollars a night for valet parking and no one even answered the phone when we had a dinner date to get our car so we had to walk to the actual place then wait for the car.

The restaurants and bars mind you that are already over priced have awful service because they are SOOOO understaffed this one poor man was literally running the entire Resturant and bar while getting yelled at. The one pool bar they had, there were like 10-12 people wrapped around in a line just to get one drink by the pool in the hot heat so we said forget it the second time 😩 The first night on arrival when I tried to take a quick rinse/shower  the water stopped draining.

But other than that the room wasn’t dirty the sheets were clean that’s all I gave you guys sadly. And I’m not one to leave reviewed but I HAD to give the next people a heads up.

Also i mentioned it to the manager and she didn’t even offer anything she said “I’ll talk to house keeping “. Most other places would at the very least try to make up for the bad service to protect their standards .. not at all.

If I could do it again I would reserve at the other ocean front hotels. My partner and I checked out the other ones and they actually looked really nice and inviting like they wanted to earn guests. I guess these big name hotels feel like because they have the name they don’t have to try as hard now? Not sure.

text: My oceanfront view was breathtaking. My sister surprised me with this hotel stay for my birthday and I was overwhelmed. I stayed on the 11th floor and everything was above exceptional, from the very clean room and wonderful breakfast staff.
prompt: A Google Maps review about a Hotel.
completion: My oceanfront view was breathtaking. My sister surprised me with this hotel stay for my birthday and I was overwhelmed. I stayed on the 11th floor and everything was above exceptional, from the very clean room and wonderful breakfast staff.

text:
Leaves a lot to expect, this has been a worse experience than other Hilton hotels, at first we booked a room on the city side part of the hotel but instead they placed us in a practically subterranean room, which smelt moist and had dead bugs on the bed. We later came to find out it had flooded during a recent hurricane. We got moved to a room on the 7th floor which is even more outdated and gross than the first, muggy, and seems to be a remnant of the late 1990s. To make matters worse after having been given the run around at this hotel for about an hour late at night.... The shower is disgusting to shower in. Stay away from this Hilton hotel. It's in serious need of actual attention.

Edit: my wife found bed bug bites all over herself....

Edit: it seems an apology has been issued for the incident but sorry doesn't fix how horrible the stay was. If you're reading this In hopes of booking a night here please reconsider, before spending a horrible night there yourself.

text: First off.....we decided to stay AFTER spending $300 on a time share tour that we are not going to do because after calling to book it over the last 3 months theres no availability every time we call. So.... Being Diamond members who decided to spend over 400,000 points on our room. We asked to extend our stay when we first got here and was declined. But as Diamond members we are guaranteed a room if requested within 48 hrs. Secondly, in our suite since we arrived the A/C has not worked. It has gotten up to 75-76 and has been set at 64-60 respectively our poor little one is all sweaty during her nap, it took having engineers come to our room 3 times over 2 days without an offer to switch rooms until they fixed it towards the end of our trip. At night it got a little chilly so I asked for 2 more blankets and they were out! So they gave us some bed sheets?!?!The Wi-Fi is absolutely garbage! It cuts out like every 10 minutes, then you have to re-sign in. The beds were absolutely horrible and honestly as a Diamond member it didn't feel much different than a regular member. I will say the employees from the valet to the room engineers/maintenence and in between were kind. But, overall I'm pretty upset about spending over 400,000 points as a Diamond member. And I am seriously considering switching credit cards with a different hotel chain! I will be following up with Hilton corporate if no refund of points are offered. I will update if/when I hear word.

text:
I'm adopted and my husband and myself me my biological sister here in Daytona 49 yrs later...needless to say, it was a fabulous experience. A bellman, Alen was stellar, all employees should follow by his example. The front desk staff was awesome, tiki bar tender Jadd(sp) spectacular. 100% will stay again.

Btw 2/6-2/8 no room service...but we'll still go back!!

text:
My family of 6 just finished a 5 night stay, to say we were underwhelmed is an understatement. We happen to be a hardworking blue-collar family, so when paying $629.00 a night for a suite at the Hilton, we were really excited to experience a stay that's above average to our typical Redroof or Days Inn stay. At arrival I was declined a military discount, not absolutely a deal breaker as I was told I was already receiving good deal by the front desk. Of course we were in town for a work conference and were also denied the block rate supposedly due to the fact that we had a suite (the only Accessible room available at the time of our reservation). Next, we arrived in our suite and had to use the restroom after our 16 hours of travel, only to find that housekeeping has definitely not done a very thorough job cleaning the toilet. Ok, fine. I pulled out some Clorox wipes and took care of it myself. At the same time, we noticed the room was excessively hot, so after settling in we called the front desk and notified them that the ac was not working, she said she would send an engineer up to check it out. At 230am when we still hadn't seen the engineer, we went to bed leaving the door open for a breeze to cool the room off. (The ac automatically turns off when the patio door is open, this was not the reason our ac was not working as we had complied with troubleshooting from the front desk) It wasn't until 2 more calls to the front desk and almost 2 days into our stay that the ac was worked on and worked at least enough to make the room bearable. Next up....showers, nothing like stepping out of a nice warm steamy shower to briefly look up when drying off and seeing black mold.......gross. Room service was not an option during our stay, a bit of a bummer as the kids were looking forward experiencing that. On the flip side we ended up dining down in the Don Ricos. It was a bit pricey at $14.00 for a pb&j sandwich with fries for the kids, needless to say there are lots of other options outside the Hilton for food choices and we made that choice for the remainder of our stay. The kid zone was non existent, the kids were really bummed about that as it was one of the reasons we had chosen to stay at the Hilton. The elevators were in a state of broken or in repair a couple times during our stay leading to extra long wait times to get to the lobby. We made our reservation for 6, had a suite for 6, paid the additional fee to have breakfast included but were informed it only included 4 so we didn't dine as a family for breakfast.

The good: At check in the kids were all given a fun craft to do, which they did and thoroughly enjoyed. Our request for extra towels and blankets was met quickly and our interactions with the staff were pleasant. The location was great as it's was very central for the things we needed to do. The beach was fantastic even though access was very limited due to damaged walk ways.  Last but most important, the unobstructed view of the ocean from our suite was fantastic.

Lesson learned, we won't be returning.

UPDATE: I called the number provided by the Hiltons response to my review. I was quickly forwarded to the manager on duty without any prolonged holding. Brooke I think, (I hope that's how her name is spelled) spoke with me for about 20 min as I recounted our stay with them and the reasons for my review. She was open to hearing what I had to say and did not discount or deny the experience we had, which was refreshing! At the end of the conversation, she let me know I would receive a partial refund (which I have received). She handled my call with complete professionalism and kindness.

No recommendation.

The owner contacted me in this forum and expressed their disappointment that they had no chance to talk to me because of the WiFi issues - however, I will stay for another 3 days (and nobody contacted me) . WiFi Update: In the last hour, I had to reconnect 10 times. Unbearable.

text: I had a great time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I wish they had microwaves in the room but I was able to find one on the main floor near the pool entrance. The hotel has aged, but compared to other places this Hilton is a dream.

text:
Beautiful location on the worlds most famous beach. Rooms were average. Our ocean front room had a view of a roof and a little ocean. If you are going for the view, get as high a room as possible. We had little interaction with the staff but everyone was nice.
Everything costs extra and only a tiny fridge and coffee maker are provided in the room. A few restaurants in the resort and outside of within walking distance.
The doors on the higher floors open to a "juliet balcony". The ocean front rooms on the 3rd floor shared a large patio area.
Overall it was great but expensive!

text: A disappointment. This used to be the premier hotel beachside, but the rooms (specifically in the North Tower) have been neglected. As my photos depict, furniture coming apart, dirty bathroom tiles, dirty floors, damp & dirty feeling carpet (didn't want to walk barefoot on it). The sink would make the most annoying "unclogging bubbling" sound as it drained. AC was loud & not efficient; musty smelling. Bed was comfortable enough & the toilet seemed new, but otherwise the room felt generally dingy & unwelcoming. The view was great, but paying for a room upgrade to be oceanfront & this is the quality of the room I paid MORE for, I would have rather not had the view but had a nicer room.

text:
Like many have said, the location is perfect, staff is nice, lobby area is nice… but the rooms are lacking.

We had an oceanview room with a king in the south tower. It was spacious and we had no problem with the air temp or water, but it felt very outdated and the bed was not great. It felt very short and the mattress wasn’t very comfy. It wasn’t horrible by any means, but not what you might expect from a Hilton resort.

Overall it’s great if your main concern is beach access and amenities (rentals, vouchers, discounts at the shop, etc.).
